field.name: LIQUID-PRECIPITATION period
field.description: The quantity of time over which the LIQUID-PRECIPITATION was measured.

field.name: LIQUID-PRECIPITATION depth
field.description: The depth of LIQUID-PRECIPITATION that is measured at the time of an observation.

field.name: LIQUID-PRECIPITATION condition
field.description: The code that denotes whether a LIQUID-PRECIPITATION depth dimension was a trace value.

value.description: Begin accumulated period (precip amount missing until end of accumulated period)
Begin deleted period (precip amount missing due to data problem)
Estimated data value (eg, from nearby station)
Incomplete precipitation amount, excludes one or more missing reports, such as one or more 15-minute reports not included in the 1-hour precip total
Incomplete precipitation amount, excludes one or more erroneous reports, such as one or more 1-hour precip amounts excluded from the 24-hour total

field.name: LIQUID-PRECIPITATION quality
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported LIQUID-PRECIPITATION data.

value.description: Passed gross limits check, data originates from an NCDC data source
Passed all quality control checks, data originate from an NCDC data source
Suspect, data originate from an NCDC data source
Erroneous, data originate from an NCDC data source
Passed gross limits check if element is present

field.name: SKY-CONDITION-OBSERVATION high cloud genus
field.description: The code that denotes a type of high cloud.

value.description: Cirrus fibratus, sometimes uncinus, not progressively invading the sky
Cirrus spissatus, in patches or entangled sheaves, which usually do not increase and sometimes seem to be the remains of the upper part of a Cumulonimbus; or Cirrus castellanus or floccus

Cirrus (often in bands) and Cirrostratus, or Cirrostratus alone, progressively invading the sky; they generally thicken as a whole; the continuous veil extends more than 45 degrees above the horizon, without the sky being totally covered.
Cirrostratus not progressively invading the sky and not entirely covering it
Cirrocumulus alone, or Cirrocumulus predominant among the High clouds

field.name: SOLAR-IRRADIANCE time period
field.description: Time period in minutes, for which the data in this section (GM1) pertainseg, 0060 = 60 minutes (1 hour).

field.name: SOLAR-IRRADIANCE global
field.description: Global horizontal irradiance measured using a precision spectral pyranometer. Unit is Watts per square meter (W/m2) in whole values. Waveband ranges from 0.4 - 2.3 micrometers.

field.name: SOLAR-IRRADIANCE global flag
field.description: The code that provides additional information regarding the global irradiance data.

value.description: Passed one-component test; data fall within max-min limitsof Kt, Kn, or Kd
Passed two-component test; data fall within 0.03 of the Gompertz boundaries
Passed three-component test; data come within + 0.03 of satisfying Kt = Kn + Kd
Passed visual inspection: not used by SERI_QC1
Failed visual inspection: not used by SERI_QC1
Value estimated; passes all pertinent SERI_QC tests
Failed one-component test; lower than allowed minimum
Failed one-component test; higher than allowed maximum
Passed three-component test but failed two-component test by 0.05

field.name: SOLAR-IRRADIANCE global quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported global irradiance value.

field.name: SOLAR-IRRADIANCE direct beam
field.description: Direct beam irradiance measured using a precision pyrheliometer. Unit is Watts per square meter (W/m2) in whole values. Waveband ranges from 0.4 - 2.3 micrometers. Instrument is mounted on a sun tracker.

field.name: SOLAR-IRRADIANCE direct beam flag
field.description: The code that provides additional information regarding the direct beam irradiance data.

field.name: SOLAR-IRRADIANCE diffuse
field.description: Diffuse irradiance measured using a precision spectral pyranometer. Unit is Watts per square meter (W/m2) in whole values. Waveband ranges from 0.4 - 2.3 micrometers. Instrument is mounted under a shadowband.

field.description: The code that provides additional information regarding the diffuse irradiance data.

field.name: SOLAR-IRRADIANCE UVB global
field.description: Ultra-violet global irradiance measured using an Ultra-violet Biometer (Solar Light). Unit is milli-watts per square meter (mW/m2) of erythema effective irradiance in whole values. Waveband ranges from 290-320 nanometers.

field.name: SOLAR-IRRADIANCE UVB global quality code

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION time period
field.description: Time period in minutes, for which the data in this section (GN1) pertainseg, 0060 = 60 minutes (1 hour).

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION upwelling global
field.description: Global radiation measured using an Epply Precision Spectral Pyranometer mounted upside down ten meters above the surface on a meteorological tower. Unit is milli-watts per square meter (mW/m2). Waveband ranges from 270 to 3000 nanometers.

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION upwelling global quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported upwelling global solar radiation value.

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION downwelling thermal infrared radiation
field.description: Infrared radiation measured using an Epply Precision Infrared Radiometer mounted upright ten meters above the surface on a meteorological tower. Unit is milli-watts per square meter (mW/m2). Waveband ranges from 3000 to 50,000 nanometers.

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION downwelling thermal infrared radiation quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported downwelling thermal infrared radiation value.

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION upwelling thermal infrared radiation
field.description: Infrared radiation measured using an Epply Precision Infrared Radiometer mounted upside-down ten meters above the surface on a meteorological tower. Unit is Watts per meter per meter (mW/m2). Waveband ranges from 3000 to 50,000 nanometers.

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION upwelling thermal infrared radiation quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported upwelling thermal infrared radiation value.

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION photosynthetically active radiation
field.description: The PAR sensor measures global solar radiation from 400 to 700 nm in Watts per square meter (mW/m2), which approximates the spectral band active in photosynthesis.

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION photosynthetically active radiation quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported photosynthetically active radiation value.

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION solar zenith angle
field.description: The Solar Zenith Angle is the angle in degrees between the sun and the perpendicular to the earth's surface. At sunrise it is 90 degrees, at noon it is a function of latitude, and at sunset it is again 90 degrees. Below the horizon value is 100. Values are reported to the nearest tens of degrees (eg, 090).

field.name: SOLAR-RADIATION solar zenith angle quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported solar zenith angle value.

field.name: NET-SOLAR time
field.description: Time period in minutes, for which the data in this section pertains - eg, 0060 = 60 minutes (1 hour).

field.name: NET-SOLAR radiation
field.description: The difference between global radiation and upwelling global radiation measured in Watts per square meter (W/m2). If negative, left most position contains a "-" sign.

field.name: NET-SOLAR radiation quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported net solar radiation value.

field.name: NET-SOLAR infrared radiation
field.description: The difference between downwelling infrared and upwelling infrared measured in Watts per square meter (W/m2). If negative, left most position contains a "-" sign.

field.name: NET-SOLAR infrared radiation quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported net infrared radiation value.

field.name: NET radiation
field.description: The total of Net Solar and Net Infrared radiation measured in Watts per square meter (W/m2).

field.name: NET radiation quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported net radiation value.

field.name: MODELED-SOLAR-IRRADIENCE time period
field.description: Time period in minutes, for which the data in this section pertains - eg, 0060 = 60 minutes (1 hour).

field.name: MODELED-SOLAR-IRRADIENCE global horizontal
field.description: Total amount of direct and diffuse solar radiation (modeled) received on a horizontal surface. Unit is watts per square meter (W/m2) in whole values.

field.name: MODELED-SOLAR-IRRADIENCE global horizontal flag
field.description: The code that provides source information regarding the global horizontal data.

value.description: Value time-shifted from SUNY satellite model
Value time-shifted from SUNY satellite model, adjusted to a minimum low-diffuse envelope

field.name: MODELED-SOLAR-IRRADIENCE direct normal
field.description: The uncertainty values are based on model type and quality of input data.

field.name: MODELED-SOLAR-IRRADIENCE uncertainty
field.description: The amount of solar radiation (modeled) on a surface normal to the sun. Unit is watts per square meter (W/m2) in whole values.

field.name: MODELED-SOLAR-IRRADIENCE direct normal flag
field.description: The code that provides source information regarding the direct normal data.

value.description: Value time-shifted from SUNY satellite model
Value time-shifted from SUNY satellite model, adjusted to a minimum low-diffuse envelope

field.name: MODELED-SOLAR-IRRADIENCE direct normal uncertainty
field.description: The uncertainty values are based on model type and quality of input data.

field.name: MODELED-SOLAR-IRRADIENCE diffuse horizontal
field.description: The amount of solar radiation (modeled) received from the sky (excluding the solar disk) on a horizontal surface. Unit is watts per square meter (W/m2) in whole values. Waveband ranges from 0.4 - 2.3 micrometers.

field.name: MODELED-SOLAR-IRRADIENCE diffuse horizontal flag
field.description: The code that provides source information regarding the diffuse horizontal data.

value.description: Value time-shifted from SUNY satellite model
Value time-shifted from SUNY satellite model, adjusted to a minimum low-diffuse envelope

field.name: MODELED-SOLAR-IRRADIENCE diffuse horizontal uncertainty
field.description: The uncertainty values are based on model type and quality of input data.

field.name: HOURLY-SOLAR-ANGLE time period
field.description: Time period in minutes, for which the data in this section pertains - eg, 0060 = 60 minutes (1 hour).

field.name: HOURLY-SOLAR-ANGLE mean zenith angle
field.description: The angle between sun and the zenith as the mean of all 1-minute sunup zenith angle values.

field.name: HOURLY-SOLAR-ANGLE mean zenith angle quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the hourly mean zenith angle.

field.name: HOURLY-SOLAR-ANGLE mean azimuth angle
field.description: The angle between sun and the north as the mean of all 1-minute sunup azimuth angle values.

field.name: HOURLY-SOLAR-ANGLE mean azimuth angle quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the hourly mean azimuth angle.

field.name: HOURLY-EXTRATERRESTRIAL-RADIATION time period
field.description: Time period in minutes, for which the data in this section pertains - eg, 0060 = 60 minutes (1 hour).

field.name: HOURLY-EXTRATERRESTRIAL-RADIATION horizontal
field.description: The amount of solar radiation received (modeled) on a horizontal surface at the top of the atmosphere. Unit is watts per square meter (W/m2) in whole values.

field.name: HOURLY-EXTRATERRESTRIAL-RADIATION horizontal quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the hourly extraterrestrial radiation on a horizontal surface value .

field.name: HOURLY-EXTRATERRESTRIAL-RADIATION normal
field.description: The amount of solar radiation received (modeled) on a surface normal to the sun at the top of the atmosphere. Unit is watts per square meter (W/m2) in whole values.

field.name: HOURLY-EXTRATERRESTRIAL-RADIATION normal quality code
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the hourly extraterrestrial radiation normal to the sun value .

field.name: HAIL size
field.description: The diameter of the largest hailstone observed.

field.name: HAIL_QC
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported HAIL size.

value.description: Passed gross limits check if element is present

field.name: GROUND-SURFACE-OBSERVATION
field.description: The code that denotes the physical condition of the ground's surface.

value.description: Surface of ground dry (no appreciable amount of dust or loose sand)
Surface of ground dry (without cracks and no appreciable amount of dust or loose sand and without snow or measurable ice cover)
Extremely dry with cracks (without snow or measurable ice cover)
Loose dry dust or sand not covering ground completely (without snow or measurable ice cover)
Loose dry dust or sand covering more than one-half of ground (but not completely)
Loose dry dust or sand covering ground completely
Thin cover of loose dry dust or sand covering ground completely (without snow or measurable ice cover)
Moderate or thick cover of loose dry dust or sand covering ground completely (without snow or measurable ice cover)
Surface of ground moist (without snow or measurable ice cover)
Surface of ground wet (standing water in small or large pools on surface)
Surface of ground wet (standing water in small or large pools on surface without snow or measurable ice cover)
Flooded (without snow or measurable ice cover)
Surface of ground frozen (without snow or measurable ice cover)
Glaze or ice on ground, but no snow or melting snow
Glaze on ground (without snow or measurable ice cover)
Snow or melting snow (with or without ice) covering less than one-half of the ground
Snow or melting snow (with or without ice) covering more than one-half of the ground but ground not completely covered
Snow or melting snow (with or without ice) covering ground completely
Loose dry snow covering less than one-half of the ground
Loose dry snow covering at least one half of the ground (but not completely)
Even layer of loose dry snow covering ground completely
Uneven layer of loose dry snow covering ground completely
Compact or wet snow (with or without ice) covering less than one-half of the ground
Compact or wet snow (with or without ice) covering at least one-half of the ground but ground not completely covered
Even layer of compact or wet snow covering ground completely
Uneven layer of compact or wet snow covering ground completely
Snow covering ground completely; deep drifts

field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported GROUND-SURFACE-OBSERVATION code.

field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported GROUND-SURFACE-OBSERVATION minimum temperature.

field.name: WIND_AVG
field.description: Time period in minutes, for which the data in this section (OB1) pertainseg, 060 = 60 minutes (1 hour).

field.name: WIND_MAX
field.description: The maximum 10 second wind speed.

field.name: WIND_MAX_QC
field.description: The code that indicates ISD's evaluation of the quality status of the maximum gust.

field.name: WIND_MAX_FLAG
field.description: A flag that indicates the network's internal evaluation of the quality status of the maximum gust.

field.name: WIND_MAX direction
field.description: The direction measured in clockwise angular degrees from which the maximum 10 second wind speed occurred.

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION bearing
field.description: The code that denotes the true bearing, measured from the reporting platform to the closest point of the principal ice edge.

value.description: Ship in shore or flaw lead
Unable to report, because of darkness, lack of visibility or because only ice of land origin is visible

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION uniform concentration
field.description: The percent concentration (surface coverage) of ice on the water surface.

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION non-uniform concentration
field.description: The code that denotes the coverage arrangement of non-uniformly distributed ice.

value.description: Strips and patches of pack ice with open water between
Strips and patches of close or very close pack ice with areas of lesser concentration between
Fast ice with open water, very open or open pack ice to seaward of the ice boundary
Fast ice with close or very close pack ice to seaward of the ice boundary
Unable to report, because of darkness, lack of visibility, or because ship is more than 0.5

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION position
field.description: The code that denotes the relative position of the reporting ship to the ice formation.

value.description: Ship in open water with floating ice in sight
In open lead or fast ice
In ice or within 0.5 nautical miles of ice edge

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION penetrability
field.description: The code that denotes the degree of ease with which the reporting ship can proceed through the ice.

value.description: Beset (Surrounded so closely by sea ice that steering control is lost.)

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION trend
field.description: The code that denotes the trend of ice conditions.

value.description: Conditions worsening; ice forming and floes freezing together
Conditions worsening; ice under slight pressure
Conditions worsening; ice under moderate or severe pressure

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION development
field.description: The code that denotes the development stage of the ice.

value.description: New ice only (frazil ice, grease ice, slush, slugs)
Nilas or ice rind, less than 10 cm thick
Young ice (grey ice, grey-white ice), 10 - 30 cm thick
Predominantly new and/or young ice with some first year ice
Predominantly thin first year ice with some new and/or young ice
All thin first year ice (30 - 70 cm thick)
Predominantly medium first year ice (70 - 120 cm thick) and thick first year ice (> 120 cm thick) with some thinner (younger) first year ice
All medium and thick first year ice
Predominantly medium and thick first year ice with some old ice (usually more than 2 m thick)
Unable to report, because of darkness, lack of visibility or because only ice of land origin is visible or because ship is more than .5 NM away from ice

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION growler-bergy-bit
field.description: The code that denotes the existence of growler and/or bergy bits.

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION growler-bergy-bit quantity
field.description: The quantity of growler and bergy bits observed in the area.

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION iceberg quantity
field.description: The quantity of icebergs observed in the area.

field.name: WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION_QC
field.description: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported WATER-SURFACE-ICE-OBSERVATION.

value.description: Passed gross limits check if element is present

field.name: OCEAN-ICE-OBSERVATION edge bearing code
field.description: The code that denotes the true bearing, measured from the reporting platform to the closest point of the principle ice edge.

value.description: Ship in shore or flaw lead
Unable to report, because of darkness, lack of visibility or because only ice of land origin is visible

field.name: edge distance dimension
field.description: The distance from the reporting ship=s location to the nearest point on the ice edge.

field.name: edge orientation code
field.description: The code that denotes the orientation of the principal ice edge and the direction relative to which the ice lies.

value.description: Orientation of ice edge impossible to estimate--ship outside the ice
Ice edge lying in a direction NE to SW with ice situated to the NW
Ice edge lying in a direction E to W with ice situated to the N
Ice edge lying in a direction SE to NW with ice situated to the NE
Ice edge lying in a direction S to N with ice situated to the E
Ice edge lying in a direction SW to NE with ice situated to the SE
Ice edge lying in a direction W to E with ice situated to the S
Ice edge lying in a direction NW to SE with ice situated to the SW
Ice edge lying in a direction N to S with ice situated to the W
Orientation of ice edge impossible to estimate--ship inside the ice

field.description: The code that denotes the type of ice formation reported in the

value.description: No ice (0 may be used to report ice blink and then a direction must be reported)
Icebergs-icebergs can be reported in plain language

field.name: navigation effect code
field.description: The code that denotes the effect of ice on navigation.

value.description: Navigation unobstructed for steamers, difficult for sailing ships
Navigation difficult for low-powered steamers, closed to sailing ships
Navigation possible only for powerful steamers
Navigation possible only for steamers constructed to withstand ice pressure
Navigation possible with the assistance of ice-breakers
Channel open in the solid ice
Navigation conditions unknown, e.g., owing to bad weather
